location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Farish, Secretary to the Government at Bombay, to William Bruce, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter confirming that the Dashtee [Dashti] sulphur mines should not be farmed on account of the East India Company.The letter includes copies of three letters discussing the sulphur mines:Letter from Charles Wright Gardiner, Secretary to Government at Fort William [Calcutta], to James Farish, dated 23 August 1816.Letter from J S Browning, Secretary to the Military Board, to C W Gardiner, dated 13 August 1816.Letter from Andrew Allen, Sub Assistant Commissary General, Commercial Office, Fort William, to Lieutenant Colonel Thomas M Werguelen, Commissary General at Fort William, dated 8 August 1816.
